statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Mr. B writes an addition equation such as 123+321=444 on the blackboard after class. Mr. G removes some of the digits and makes it look like ��1?3+??1=44?��. Here ��?�� denotes removed digits. After Mr. B realizes some digits are missing, he wants to recover them. Unfortunately, there may be more than one way to complete the equation. For example ��1?3+??1=44?�� can be completed to ��123+321=444�� , ��143+301=444�� and many other possible solutions. Your job is to determine the number of different possible solutions.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: Each test case describes a single line with an equation like a+b=c which contains exactly one plus sign ��+�� and one equal sign ��=�� with some question mark ��?�� represent missing digits. You may assume a, b and c are non-negative integers, and the length of each number is no more than 9. In the other words, the equation will contain three integers less than 1,000,000,000.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, display a single line with its case number and the number of possible solutions to recover the equation.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
Case 1: 3
Case 2: 1


Hint

There are three solutions for the first case:
7+10=17, 7+11=18, 7+12=19
There is only one solution for the second case:
11+11=22
Note that 01+21=22 is not a valid solution because extra leading zeros are not allowed.
